CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Post-Distribution stage positioned above or below the Billed Consumption stage?
SRP.A: The Post-Distribution stage is positioned {above} the Billed Consumption stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Total Energy Generated?
VE.A: The value of stage Total Energy Generated is {72635}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Billed Consumption?
VE.A: The value of stage Billed Consumption is {7738}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Total Energy Generated, with a value of {72635}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Billed Consumption, with a value of {7738}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Post-Generation to stage Post-Transmission?
SC.A: Decreased by {16436} Megawatt Hours from stage Post-Generation to stage Post-Transmission.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 22267? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Total Energy Generated} stage has {72635}, the {Post-Generation} stage has {44535}, the {Post-Transmission} stage has {28099}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 8389? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 8389 and 36317? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Post-Transmission} stage has {28099}, the {Post-Distribution} stage has {16436}, the {Delivered to End Users} stage has {9040}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Total Energy Generated to Post-Generation, or from stage Post-Distribution to Delivered to End Users?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Total Energy Generated} to {Post-Generation} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Post-Distribution to Delivered to End Users, from stage Total Energy Generated to Post-Generation, or from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Total Energy Generated} to stage {Post-Generation} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Total Energy Generated} and {Post-Generation} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Delivered to End Users} and {Billed Consumption} stages.
